Legal_Issue: Whether the officer applied the correct test for H&C application and considered all relevant evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Risk as part of hardship was considered; financial, medical, and familial hardships were ignored; economic conditions in Nigeria and personal circumstances were overlooked
Legal_Rule: H&C applications require assessing unusual, disproportionate, or undeserved hardship
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision due to incomplete consideration of hardship factors
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer failed to consider all relevant evidence, leading to unfair outcome
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds under Canadian immigration law
Court_Result: Case remanded for reconsideration by another officer with updated evidence
Evidence_Type: Financial, medical, familial, country condition evidence
Outcome: Application denied initially; decision overturned on judicial review; case remanded
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review and referral for re-assessment
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, case referred for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Assessment of unusual, disproportionate, or undeserved hardship in H&C applications
